instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2879: What is 820-2879? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sudden restarts
threads.message:
Hi everyone, 
Restarts at various different stages - on OS X after a few seconds, after long usage, during booting.
Any ideas?
Thanks guys.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sudden restarts
threads.message:
Hello !
Please explain more details...    
 you have done several tests?
magsafe? mesures of voltages? research on logic board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sudden restarts
threads.message: What should i test exactly? ASD finds no error, sometimes comes the ram error beeping sounds, but on the next try turns on perfectly, magsafe lights as it should and battery charges as it should. voltages on the board look fine to me, should i test the voltages for any specific component? i have the brd file for this board.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sudden restarts
threads.message: Try one RAM slot at a time and see if problem remains, the battery is original????

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sudden restarts
threads.message: Have done that extensively, same result, different DIMMs and different combinations.it's a very weird case for me.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sudden restarts
threads.message: Did you try ONE slot at a time, could be one bad RAM slot. Also these boards you MUST use PC8500 RAM.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sudden restarts
threads.message: Sure. That was the first step, different DIMMs of 1066 in different combinations. always same error.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sudden restarts
threads.message: This was probably dropped. Cracked PCB traces under SMC or RAM slots. This goes in the garbage pile, sorry.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2879</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> sudden restarts
